intro: Reseda lanceolata var. constricta, commonly known as narrowleaf madder, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. The plant is typically found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes other plants known for their medicinal and dye-producing properties. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its historical use in natural dyeing processes.
